contents.text:
Student email: student@example.com
Study plan:
{"rationale":"I grouped the weeks by AZ-305’s scenario-based design domains and the provided Microsoft Learn modules/paths so each week builds on prior architectural decisions: (1) governance/identity/monitoring first because it constrains all later designs (landing zones, policy, RBAC, observability). (2) Data storage and integration next because application and infrastructure choices depend on data characteristics (relational vs non-relational, durability, latency, replication, ingestion). (3) HA/DR and backup after core platform choices so you can apply resiliency patterns to the designs you’ve already made. (4) Compute/app architecture/networking/migration last because they require combining earlier constraints into end-to-end solutions and tradeoffs. Pacing: ~6 hours/week across 6 days (one lighter review day) with a weekly checkpoint; heavier modules are split over multiple days and each week ends with consolidation via scenario notes and self-quizzing before moving on.","planTitle":"AZ-305 (Advanced) — 8-Week / 6 Hours-Per-Week Milestone Plan","durationWeeks":8,"weeklyHours":6,"weeklyMilestones":[{"weekNumber":1,"objective":"Design governance foundations (management hierarchy, policies, and operating model) and produce a baseline landing-zone governance sketch.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Start Learning Path: AZ-305: Design identity, governance, and monitor solutions (overview + skim module list for scope).","Module: Design governance — complete first half (management groups, subscriptions, resource groups).","Create a 1-page draft: management group tree + subscription strategy for a fictitious org (prod/non-prod/shared)."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design governance — complete second half (Azure Policy, compliance, RBAC at scale concepts).","Write decision notes: when to use Policy vs RBAC vs Blueprints (legacy) and where each applies."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Reinforcement: map governance controls to common scenarios (data exfiltration, region restrictions, tag enforcement, allowed SKUs).","Update your 1-page governance sketch with 5–8 example policies/initiatives you’d deploy."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module recap: extract “design triggers” (signals that indicate a specific governance choice).","Create 15 flashcards/Q&A prompts from the module (e.g., ‘When would you split subscriptions?’)."]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Hands-on thought exercise: design a ‘platform subscription’ vs ‘application subscription’ model and list pros/cons.","Quick self-quiz using your flashcards; fill gaps in notes."]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Weekly review: summarize governance in a scenario format (requirements → constraints → design).","Checkpoint prep: write a short answer to 2 scenarios (enterprise with multiple BUs; regulated workload with strict region limits)."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverable: a concise landing-zone governance sketch (management groups/subscriptions + policy/RBAC approach) and written rationale for at least 2 governance scenarios."},{"weekNumber":2,"objective":"Design identity, access, and monitoring architecture decisions that enforce least privilege and enable operational visibility.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design authentication and authorization solutions — cover identity basics, tenants, and authentication approaches.","Write decision notes: when to use Entra ID vs AD DS vs hybrid identity patterns."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Continue Module: Design authentication and authorization solutions — authorization, RBAC patterns, PIM concepts (as design choice).","Create a reference table: ‘Requirement → recommended authN/authZ components’."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design a solution to log and monitor Azure resources — cover monitoring goals, signals, and Log Analytics workspace strategy.","Draft a monitoring architecture: workspace strategy (central vs per-subscription), data retention, and access model."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Continue Module: Design a solution to log and monitor Azure resources — alerting, routing, and platform logs.","Add design notes: when to use metrics vs logs; recommended alert strategy for platform vs app."]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Integration exercise: apply identity + monitoring to a scenario (multi-subscription app with separate ops/security teams).","Create 10 scenario Qs: identity boundaries, RBAC, and logging access patterns."]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Weekly review: rewrite your monitoring design as a checklist (collection → storage → access → alerting → response).","Checkpoint practice: answer 2 end-to-end prompts (identity + monitoring) in <15 minutes each."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverable: an identity and monitoring design memo (tenant/hybrid/authZ approach + Log Analytics/workspace/alerting strategy) plus answers to 2 timed scenarios."},{"weekNumber":3,"objective":"Design non-relational storage solutions and protection strategies (durability, redundancy, security) aligned to workload requirements.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Start Learning Path: AZ-305: Design data storage solutions (overview + where each module fits).","Module: Design a data storage solution for non-relational data — cover storage account options and core services.","Create a selection guide: Blob vs Files vs Disks vs queues/tables (when/why)."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Continue non-relational module — focus on redundancy (LRS/ZRS/GRS/GZRS), performance tiers, and access patterns.","Write 5 tradeoff statements (cost vs durability vs latency vs region)."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Continue non-relational module — security design (networking controls, encryption, identity-based access).","Draft a storage security baseline: private endpoints, firewall rules, key management choices."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Scenario drills: design storage for (1) media streaming assets (2) VM disks (3) file shares for lift-and-shift app.","For each, define redundancy + access + security + lifecycle management."]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Review and consolidation: build a one-page ‘non-relational storage decision tree’.","Self-quiz: 15 rapid prompts based on your decision tree."]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Weekly review: identify 3 common pitfalls (e.g., wrong redundancy, public access, poor tiering) and how to mitigate.","Checkpoint prep: 2 timed storage design responses with explicit justification."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverable: a one-page non-relational storage decision tree and two scenario-based designs including redundancy + security choices and justifications."},{"weekNumber":4,"objective":"Design relational data storage choices (Azure SQL family options) and data protection/availability patterns.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design a data storage solution for relational data — cover service options and selection criteria.","Create comparison notes: Azure SQL Database vs Managed Instance vs SQL on VM (when/why)."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Continue relational module — scalability and availability patterns, read scale, and performance considerations.","Write a ‘requirements to option’ mapping (compatibility, features, instance-level needs)."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Continue relational module — backup/restore concepts and protection-related design considerations at the database tier.","List design constraints that push toward MI or SQL on VM (and what you lose/gain)."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design data integration — cover integration patterns and service selection at a high level.","Draft an integration architecture for ‘OLTP to analytics + operational reporting’ (batch vs near-real-time)."]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Continue Module: Design data integration — map services to patterns (ingest, transform, orchestrate).","Create 10 scenario prompts focused on integration choices and rationale."]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Weekly review: synthesize relational + integration into 2 end-to-end scenarios.","Checkpoint practice: 1 timed ‘choose SQL option’ scenario + 1 timed ‘integration pattern’ scenario."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverable: a relational option comparison sheet and two complete scenario write-ups (relational choice + integration approach + key tradeoffs)."},{"weekNumber":5,"objective":"Design high availability and disaster recovery strategies using RTO/RPO-driven decisions across IaaS/PaaS/hybrid workloads.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Describe high availability and disaster recovery strategies — focus on HA vs DR, RTO/RPO interpretation.","Create a matrix: workload type (VM/app service/data) → HA pattern → DR pattern."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Continue HA/DR module — region pairs, availability zones, multi-region patterns (active/active, active/passive).","Write 6 tradeoff bullets: complexity vs cost vs recovery speed vs data consistency."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Scenario drills: choose HA/DR for (1) stateless web tier (2) stateful DB tier (3) hybrid identity dependency.","For each, explicitly set RTO/RPO and map to design."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Reinforcement: document failover considerations (DNS, traffic routing, data replication, automation).","Create a ‘DR runbook outline’ template (steps only; no tooling deep dive)."]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Review day: convert HA/DR notes into 12 flashcards emphasizing decision triggers.","Mini mock: 20 minutes of scenario answers + 40 minutes review of misses."]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Weekly review: produce an end-to-end resiliency architecture for a 3-tier app (web/app/db) including region + zone strategy.","Checkpoint prep: write a short justification paragraph for each tier."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverable: an HA/DR decision matrix and a complete 3-tier resiliency design including explicit RTO/RPO assumptions and design rationale."},{"weekNumber":6,"objective":"Design backup and disaster recovery solutions, aligning backup strategy with broader resiliency architecture and operational requirements.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design a solution for backup and disaster recovery — cover backup goals, scope, and selection criteria.","Draft a backup policy template: cadence, retention, vault/workspace placement, access controls."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Continue backup/DR module — align backup with workload types and compliance (immutability/soft delete concepts as design).","Write decision notes: backup vs replication vs both; when each is required."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Scenario drills: backup/DR for (1) critical SQL workload (2) file shares (3) VM-based legacy app.","For each, specify restore requirements and operational considerations (testing, least privilege)."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Integration exercise: combine Week 5 HA/DR with backup into one coherent story for a business-critical app.","Identify gaps: what replication won’t cover; what backup won’t meet for RTO."]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Review: build a checklist ‘Backup design in 10 questions’ (what to ask stakeholders).","Self-quiz with your own checklist against two sample apps."]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Weekly review: write a one-page ‘Resiliency and data protection strategy’ that references HA/DR + backup.","Checkpoint practice: timed scenario response focused on recovery options and justification."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverable: a reusable backup design checklist + one-page resiliency/data protection strategy for a sample workload, including what meets RTO/RPO and what doesn’t."},{"weekNumber":7,"objective":"Design compute and application architecture solutions (service selection, patterns, and tradeoffs) aligned to security, governance, and data needs.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Start Learning Path: AZ-305: Design infrastructure solutions (skim scope; identify compute/app/network/migration pieces).","Module: Design an Azure compute solution — cover VM vs containers vs serverless decision criteria.","Create a compute selection table keyed by scaling model, ops burden, and latency."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Continue compute module — focus on scaling/availability considerations tied to earlier HA/DR principles.","Write 5 scenario triggers that push toward each compute option."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design an application architecture — cover core app architecture patterns (messaging/event-driven, API exposure, caching).","Draft a reference architecture diagram (boxes/arrows) for an event-driven workload."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Continue app architecture module — configuration, deployment considerations at design level, and integration points with monitoring.","Update your diagram with observability (logs/metrics/tracing) and identity boundaries."]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Scenario drill: choose compute + app architecture for 2 scenarios (B2C web app; internal batch processing).","Write explicit tradeoffs and how governance/identity constraints affect the design."]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Weekly review: compress compute + app patterns into a 2-page ‘architecture patterns cheat sheet’.","Checkpoint: 1 timed end-to-end scenario (compute + app + data + monitoring) response."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverable: a compute selection table, an application reference diagram, and one timed end-to-end design response with explicit tradeoffs."},{"weekNumber":8,"objective":"Design network and migration solutions; complete full-domain consolidation and exam-style scenario practice.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design network solutions — cover connectivity options and design constraints (segmentation, routing, private access).","Create a network decision tree: internet-facing vs private, hub-spoke vs flat, regional/global needs."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Continue network module — load balancing/routing design and security posture considerations.","Draft a hub-spoke diagram with key services (ingress/egress, shared services, private endpoints)."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design migrations — cover migration strategy choices and key planning concepts.","Write a migration plan outline: discovery → assessment → wave planning → cutover → optimization."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Continue migrations module — align migration approach to app types (rehost/refactor/etc.) and dependencies (identity/data).","Create 2 migration scenario answers emphasizing rationale and risks."]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Consolidation: build an ‘AZ-305 master checklist’ across governance/identity/monitoring/data/BCDR/infra.","Do a 60-minute mini-mock: 6 multi-step scenarios (10 minutes each) using your checklist."]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Final review: analyze misses from mini-mock; patch notes and add 10 new flashcards on weak areas.","Checkpoint: write one complete reference architecture narrative (requirements → design → tradeoffs → ops)."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverable: network hub-spoke design + migration plan outline + completed mini-mock with retrospected gaps and a final end-to-end reference architecture narrative."}],"briefMessageToUser":"Follow the daily sessions as written (60 minutes/day, 6 days/week) and treat the weekly checkpoints as non-optional deliverables—AZ-305 rewards clear tradeoff thinking and repeatable scenario structure more than memorizing features. If you keep a running ‘decision log’ and a single evolving reference architecture, you’ll steadily convert module knowledge into exam-ready design judgment."}

Produce JSON only matching the provided schema

{"rationale":"This engagement plan mirrors the student’s 8-week, 6-days/week AZ-305 pacing by sending a reminder for each 60-minute session plus a weekly checkpoint nudge. Each reminder points to the most relevant Microsoft Learn resource so the student can jump directly into the exact domain module/path (governance, identity/monitoring, data storage/integration, HA/DR, backup, compute/app architecture, networking, and migration) and maintain steady scenario-based practice aligned to AZ-305.","recipientEmail":"student@example.com","reminders":[{"schedule":"2026-02-24T08:00:00","subject":"Wk1 D1 — Start AZ-305 identity/governance/monitor path + begin Governance module","body":"Kick off Week 1 by skimming the AZ-305 identity/governance/monitor learning path, then complete the first half of the Governance design module and draft your management group + subscription strategy (prod/non-prod/shared).","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-identity-governance-monitor-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-02-25T08:00:00","subject":"Wk1 D2 — Finish Governance module + decision notes (Policy vs RBAC vs Blueprints)","body":"Finish the Governance module today and capture crisp decision notes on when to use Azure Policy vs RBAC (and why Blueprints is legacy) so your landing-zone sketch stays exam-ready.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-identity-governance-monitor-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-02-26T08:00:00","subject":"Wk1 D3 — Map governance controls to real scenarios + add example policies","body":"Turn governance theory into design instinct: map controls to common scenarios (exfiltration, region limits, tags, allowed SKUs) and add 5–8 example policies/initiatives to your sketch.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-identity-governance-monitor-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-02-27T08:00:00","subject":"Wk1 D4 — Governance design triggers + 15 flashcards","body":"Extract ‘design triggers’ from the governance content and convert them into 15 Q&A flashcards—these become your fast recall tool for scenario questions.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-identity-governance-monitor-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-02-28T08:00:00","subject":"Wk1 D5 — Platform vs app subscription model + self-quiz","body":"Design a platform subscription vs application subscription model (pros/cons), then do a quick flashcard self-quiz and patch any weak spots immediately.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-identity-governance-monitor-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-01T08:00:00","subject":"Wk1 D6 — Weekly governance review + 2 scenario write-ups","body":"Wrap Week 1 by writing governance in scenario format (requirements → constraints → design) and answer two short scenarios to lock in your landing-zone rationale.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-identity-governance-monitor-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-01T18:00:00","subject":"Week 1 Checkpoint — Landing-zone governance sketch deliverable","body":"Non-optional checkpoint: finalize your concise landing-zone governance sketch (MG/subscriptions + Policy/RBAC approach) and include written rationale for at least two governance scenarios.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-identity-governance-monitor-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-02T08:00:00","subject":"Wk2 D1 — AuthN/AuthZ module (identity basics) + Entra vs AD DS notes","body":"Start the authentication/authorization design module and write decision notes on when to use Microsoft Entra ID vs AD DS vs hybrid patterns—keep it requirement-driven.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-identity-governance-monitor-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-03T08:00:00","subject":"Wk2 D2 — Authorization patterns + PIM (design choice) + requirement table","body":"Continue the AuthN/AuthZ module focusing on authorization patterns and PIM as a design control, then build your ‘Requirement → recommended auth components’ reference table.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-identity-governance-monitor-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-04T08:00:00","subject":"Wk2 D3 — Monitoring module (signals + workspace strategy) + draft architecture","body":"Start the log/monitor module and draft your monitoring architecture: workspace strategy (central vs per-subscription), retention, and access model.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-identity-governance-monitor-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-05T08:00:00","subject":"Wk2 D4 — Monitoring: alerting/routing/platform logs + metrics vs logs notes","body":"Finish the monitoring module sections on alerting/routing/platform logs, and add clear notes on when to use metrics vs logs plus a platform vs app alert strategy.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-identity-governance-monitor-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-06T08:00:00","subject":"Wk2 D5 — Integrate identity + monitoring in a multi-sub scenario + 10 scenario Qs","body":"Apply identity + monitoring to a multi-subscription scenario (separate ops/security teams) and write 10 scenario questions to pressure-test boundaries and access patterns.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-identity-governance-monitor-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-07T08:00:00","subject":"Wk2 D6 — Monitoring checklist rewrite + 2 timed prompts (<15 min)","body":"Rewrite your monitoring design as a practical checklist (collect → store → access → alert → respond), then do two timed identity+monitoring prompts to build speed.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-identity-governance-monitor-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-07T18:00:00","subject":"Week 2 Checkpoint — Identity + monitoring design memo","body":"Deliver the identity & monitoring design memo (tenant/hybrid/authZ + workspace/alerting strategy) and submit two timed scenario answers—clarity and tradeoffs matter most.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-identity-governance-monitor-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-09T08:00:00","subject":"Wk3 D1 — Start AZ-305 data storage path + non-relational module basics","body":"Kick off the data storage learning path, then start the non-relational storage design module and create your selection guide (Blob vs Files vs Disks vs queues/tables).","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-data-storage-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-10T08:00:00","subject":"Wk3 D2 — Non-relational: redundancy + tiers + access patterns (5 tradeoffs)","body":"Focus today on redundancy (LRS/ZRS/GRS/GZRS), performance tiers, and access patterns, then write 5 explicit tradeoffs (cost/durability/latency/region).","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-data-storage-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-11T08:00:00","subject":"Wk3 D3 — Non-relational security baseline (private endpoints, firewall, keys)","body":"Design for security: draft your storage security baseline covering private endpoints, firewall rules, encryption, and key management choices.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-data-storage-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-12T08:00:00","subject":"Wk3 D4 — Storage scenario drills (media, disks, file shares)","body":"Run three storage scenarios (streaming assets, VM disks, lift-and-shift file shares) and specify redundancy, access, security, and lifecycle management for each.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-data-storage-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-13T08:00:00","subject":"Wk3 D5 — Build decision tree + 15 rapid prompts","body":"Consolidate into a one-page non-relational storage decision tree, then test it with 15 rapid prompts to ensure you can justify choices fast.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-data-storage-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-14T08:00:00","subject":"Wk3 D6 — Pitfalls + 2 timed storage designs","body":"Identify three common storage pitfalls and how you’d mitigate them, then complete two timed storage design responses with explicit justification.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-data-storage-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-14T18:00:00","subject":"Week 3 Checkpoint — Non-relational decision tree + 2 scenario designs","body":"Submit your one-page non-relational storage decision tree and two scenario-based designs (redundancy + security + justification).","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-data-storage-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-16T08:00:00","subject":"Wk4 D1 — Relational storage module + SQL option comparison notes","body":"Start the relational storage design module and create comparison notes for Azure SQL Database vs Managed Instance vs SQL on VM based on real requirements.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-data-storage-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-17T08:00:00","subject":"Wk4 D2 — Relational: scalability/availability + requirements→option mapping","body":"Continue relational design focusing on scalability and availability, then write a requirements-to-option mapping (compatibility/features/instance-level needs).","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-data-storage-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-18T08:00:00","subject":"Wk4 D3 — Relational: backup/restore constraints + MI vs SQL VM triggers","body":"Cover backup/restore concepts and list the constraints that push you toward Managed Instance or SQL on VM—be explicit about what you gain/lose.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-data-storage-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-19T08:00:00","subject":"Wk4 D4 — Data integration module + OLTP→analytics architecture draft","body":"Start the data integration module and draft an integration architecture for OLTP to analytics + operational reporting (batch vs near-real-time).","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-data-storage-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-20T08:00:00","subject":"Wk4 D5 — Integration: map services to patterns + 10 scenario prompts","body":"Map integration services to ingest/transform/orchestrate patterns and write 10 scenario prompts that force you to defend your integration choice.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-data-storage-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-21T08:00:00","subject":"Wk4 D6 — Synthesize relational + integration + 2 timed scenarios","body":"Synthesize relational + integration into two end-to-end scenarios, then do one timed ‘choose SQL option’ and one timed ‘integration pattern’ response.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-data-storage-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-21T18:00:00","subject":"Week 4 Checkpoint — Relational comparison sheet + 2 scenario write-ups","body":"Finalize your relational option comparison sheet and deliver two complete scenario write-ups (relational choice + integration approach + key tradeoffs).","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-data-storage-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-23T08:00:00","subject":"Wk5 D1 — HA/DR strategies module + RTO/RPO matrix","body":"Start the HA/DR strategies module and build your matrix mapping workload type (VM/app/data) to HA pattern and DR pattern using RTO/RPO assumptions.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/describe-high-availability-and-disaster-recovery-strategies/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-24T08:00:00","subject":"Wk5 D2 — HA/DR: region pairs/zones + multi-region tradeoffs","body":"Cover region pairs, availability zones, and active/active vs active/passive patterns, then write 6 tradeoff bullets (complexity/cost/recovery speed/consistency).","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/describe-high-availability-and-disaster-recovery-strategies/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-25T08:00:00","subject":"Wk5 D3 — HA/DR scenario drills (web, DB, hybrid identity dependency)","body":"Do three scenario drills and explicitly set RTO/RPO for each tier (stateless web, stateful DB, hybrid identity dependency) before mapping to a design.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/describe-high-availability-and-disaster-recovery-strategies/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-26T08:00:00","subject":"Wk5 D4 — Failover considerations + DR runbook outline template","body":"Document failover considerations (DNS, traffic routing, replication, automation) and produce a DR runbook outline template you can reuse in scenarios.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/describe-high-availability-and-disaster-recovery-strategies/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-27T08:00:00","subject":"Wk5 D5 — 12 HA/DR flashcards + mini-mock (20 min)","body":"Convert your HA/DR notes into 12 decision-trigger flashcards, then do a 20-minute mini-mock and spend the remaining time reviewing misses.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/describe-high-availability-and-disaster-recovery-strategies/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-28T08:00:00","subject":"Wk5 D6 — 3-tier resiliency architecture + tier justifications","body":"Design an end-to-end resiliency architecture for a 3-tier app (web/app/db) including region+zone strategy, and write a short justification paragraph for each tier.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/describe-high-availability-and-disaster-recovery-strategies/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-28T18:00:00","subject":"Week 5 Checkpoint — HA/DR decision matrix + 3-tier resiliency design","body":"Deliver your HA/DR decision matrix and the complete 3-tier resiliency design with explicit RTO/RPO assumptions and rationale.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/describe-high-availability-and-disaster-recovery-strategies/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-30T08:00:00","subject":"Wk6 D1 — Backup & DR design module + backup policy template","body":"Start the backup/DR design module and draft a backup policy template (cadence, retention, vault placement, access controls) that you can reuse across scenarios.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-a-solution-for-backup-and-disaster-recovery/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-31T08:00:00","subject":"Wk6 D2 — Backup vs replication vs both + compliance design notes","body":"Continue the module focusing on compliance-driven features (immutability/soft delete as design choices) and write decision notes on when you need backup, replication, or both.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-a-solution-for-backup-and-disaster-recovery/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-01T08:00:00","subject":"Wk6 D3 least-privilege operations.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-a-solution-for-backup-and-disaster-recovery/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-02T08:00:00","subject":"Wk6 D4 — backup can’t meet for RTO.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-a-solution-for-backup-and-disaster-recovery/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-03T08:00:00","subject":"Wk6 D5 — automatic.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-a-solution-for-backup-and-disaster-recovery/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-04T08:00:00","subject":"Wk6 D6 — 1-page scenario with justification.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-a-solution-for-backup-and-disaster-recovery/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-04T18:00:00","subject":"Week 6 what doesn’t.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-a-solution-for-backup-and-disaster-recovery/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-06T08:00:00","subject":"Wk7 D1 — Start constraints change the design.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-infrastructure-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-11T08:00:00","subject":"Wk7 D6 — 2-page patterns practice full synthesis.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-infrastructure-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-11T18:00:00","subject":"Week 7 Checkpoint — Compute risks.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-migrations/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-17T08:00:00","subject":"Wk8 D5 — Build AZ-305 master checklist + 60-min mini-mock (6 structure.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/exams/az-305/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-18T08:00:00","subject":"Wk8 D6 — Analyze misses + 10 new flashcards + full tradeoffs → ops).","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/exams/az-305/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-18T18:00:00","subject":"Week 8 Checkpoint — Network hub-spoke + architecture narrative.","body_link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/exams/az-305/"}],"motivationMessages":[{"schedule":"2026-02-24T07:30:00","body":"Keep today’s output small and concrete: one draft diagram/page beats perfect notes—your landing-zone sketch will evolve all 8 weeks."},{"schedule":"2026-03-03T07:30:00","body":"When a scenario feels ambiguous, anchor on requirements first, then state assumptions explicitly—AZ-305 rewards clear, defendable tradeoffs."},{"schedule":"2026-03-11T07:30:00","body":"If you can explain a storage choice in one sentence (workload + constraint → service + redundancy), you’re at exam speed—keep practicing that form."},{"schedule":"2026-03-25T07:30:00","body":"RTO/RPO are your north star this week—make every HA/DR answer start with them, even if you have to choose reasonable assumptions."},{"schedule":"2026-04-03T07:30:00","body":"Backup isn’t just ‘turn it on’—keep asking: what are we restoring, how fast, who can do it, and how do we prove it works?"},{"schedule":"2026-04-10T07:30:00","body":"Compute and app architecture answers get easier when you reuse patterns—pick one reference architecture and refine it instead of starting from scratch."},{"schedule":"2026-04-17T07:30:00","body":"Mini-mock day: don’t aim for perfect—aim for structured answers. Use your checklist to stay consistent under time pressure."}],"briefMessageToUser":"I scheduled one reminder per daily 60-minute session plus a weekly checkpoint nudge, each linked to the most relevant Microsoft Learn resource so you can jump straight into the right module/path. Treat checkpoints as deliverables and keep a running decision log—your scenario structure and tradeoff clarity will compound week over week."}
